titleStmt.title: The propositions of the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament. For a safe and well-grounded peace. Sent to His Majestie at Newcastle, by the Right Honourable the Earle of Pembroke and Montgomery. The earle of Suffolke. Members of the House of Peeres. And Sir Walter Erle Sir John Hipisly [brace] Knights [double brace] Robert Goodwyn Luke Robinson [brace] Esq; members of the House of Commons. Die Mercurii 15. Julii 1646. It is this day ordered by the Lords in Parliament, that the printer belonging to this House shall forthwith print the propositions sent to his majesty at Newcastle for a safe and well grounded peace. And that no other person shall presume to print or reprint the same, or any part thereof, at their perils. Joh. Brown Cler. Parliamentorum.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.
Pembroke, Philip Herbert, Earl of, 1584-1650.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Iohn Wright at the Kings Head in the old Bayley.,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Kings Head in the old Bayley.
